job_title: Home Care Administrator in Wyomissing, PA
pros:
Well run facility
Safety and kindness are primary
Excellence is the standard for everything
cons: Excellence as the standard is challenging if you don't believe in the mission of providing quality service.

review_title: Id turn back if i were you
pros: PTO builds quickly, for me it was close to home and the residents were very kind
cons:
Everything else, unfair wages, no existent raises, bad food, stupid reasons to be called in in the middle of the nignt, 
They do not know the difference between an emergency and what can wait until the next shift. Pointless weekend requirements
CEO is all show and no go.

job_title: Health Services Supervisor in Wyomissing, PA
pros: The residents are nice. The facility is nice I guess.
cons: Expect you to sell your soul for the company for pennies in compensation. Fake nice.

job_title: Home Care Aide in Wyomissing, PA
pros: Very flexible work schedule, friendly environment
cons: Inconsistent weekly schedule that can change by the day.

pros: Good benefits, staff parties & events happen often
cons: Administration/management is unwilling to work with their staff to come to solutions, instead they make all decisions with no input from those of us who provide the direct care to residents. Favoritism runs rampant and unequal pay happens often. Supervisors treat their staff like children rather than co-workers. Often feels like you cannot go to your supervisor with important issues because they won't make time for you, or if they have time, and the actually listen, you are basically ignored.

review_title: The best place to work and make an impact!
pros:
Wonderful location, friendly people (people who live here and work here), excellent benefits, great work environment!  I have blessed to be employed by such a wonderful organization.  

If you don't want to be held accountable for doing your job, if you don't want to make a difference, or if being the best isn't for you - The Highlands at Wyomissing may not be a place you want to work.  Only committed, dedicated, and compassionate people thrive.
cons: I have no cons to share!  This place is great!

pros: Short shifts (about 3 hours), friendly employees, very helpful to new workers, easy sign in/sign out to keep track of hours
cons: Hard to get longer shifts, will fire if you can't work for a month or so at a time (won't keep you for coming back)

pros: People are actually nice! It’s not just something that is preached, we live it everyday. It makes all the difference when you walk into an atmosphere that is friendly and accepting.
cons: None that I can think of!

pros: You get paid every two weeks.  There are a few very nice staff member to work with.  Most of the good ones have already left.
cons: Upper management is ridiculously poor.  They have used and abused all of the good nurses and CNA's in the area.
